text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.71.20, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures.
) IRM
provides guidance and information to help agents working Employee Plans (EP) Case Support Examination cases. (

) These procedures are mandatory for all cases that are EP Large Case Support Examination coordinated with Large Business & International (LB&I) and Exempt Organization (EO) Team Examination Program (TEP). (
) This IRM is intended to provide supplemental information for procedures speciﬁc to EP Large Support Examinations and it is not intended to replace IRM
, Overview of Form
Examination Procedures or IRM
, Employee Plans Large Case Examinations.

These procedures are mandatory for all cases that are EP Large Case Support Examination coordinated with Large Business & International (LB&I) and Exempt Organization (EO) Team Examination Program (TEP).

This IRM is intended to provide supplemental information for procedures speciﬁc to EP Large Case Support Examinations and it is not intended to replace IRM 4.71.1, Overview of Form 5500 Examination Procedures or IRM 4.71.16, Employee Plans Large Case Examinations.

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This incorporates the following interim guidance memos: TEGE-04-0720-0014, Interim Guidance on Fully Electronic (100% Paperless) Cases TEGE-04-0720-0018, Elimination of Requirement to Use Paper Form 895/895-EP TEGE-04-0920-0024, Revisions to Activity, Disposal, Source and Status Codes TEGE-04-1220-0025, Location of IRM Exhibits for EP Examination Employees

Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures 4.71.20
Scope and (
) The Employee Plans (EP) examination program was established to ensure: a. Compliance with the provisions of Internal Revenue Code (IRC)
(a). b. That taxes related to trust assets are being properly reported. (
) Purpose : IRM

, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures, contains procedures, guidance and information to help agents working Employee Plans (EP) Case Support Examination cases. (
) Audience : This IRM provides procedures for agents, managers, and support staff in EP Exam. (
) Program Owner : Director, EP Examinations sets the program for the EP amination program. (
) Program Authority : EP Examinations’ authority to conduct examinations, resolve issues and determine tax liability is derived from Title
, Internal Revenue Code, Subtitle F – Procedure and Administration, which includes is not limited to:. a. IRC section
- Examination of books and witnesses, which falls under Chapter
- Discovery of Liability and Enforcement of Title. Note: IRC

Employee Plans Examination of Returns
The Employee Plans examination program’s primary objective is regulatory, emphasizing continued qualiﬁcation of employee beneﬁt plans (Policy Statement 4-119) EP selects and examines returns to:

a. Given broad authority to consider and weigh conﬂicting information, data, and opinions. b. To use professional judgement according to auditing standards to make ﬁndings of fact and apply the IRS’s position on issues of law to determine the correct tax liability. c. To exercise this authority to obtain the greatest number of tax determina
tion agreements without sacriﬁcing the quality or integrity of those determinations and to dispose of tax differences at the lowest level.
This manual uses the following acronyms and references the following forms.

Deduction Only Support Examinations - restricted to income tax issues. LB&I Support Examinations Involving Plan Qualiﬁcation - involve IRC
(a) plan qualiﬁcation support, which may include the deduction. EO Support Examinations Involving Plan Qualiﬁcation - involve IRC
(a), IRC
(b) and IRC
plan support, which may include the plan sponsor’s deduction for contributions to its retirement arrangement.
Employee Plans Examination of Returns

Every EP Large Case Support Examination with LB&I or EO Exam requires agents to complete and include an audit plan in the EP examination case ﬁle, which at a minimum should describe the extent of the EP examination activity.
The following terms are used in EP Large Case Support Examinations with
The following terms are used in EP Large Case Support Examinations with LB&I or EO

Term Deﬁnition Benchmark Events target dates or time-lines for speciﬁc actions, such as: • Case start and completion dates • Timing of issuing and re- sponding to Information Document Requests (IDRs) and Notices of Proposed Adjustments (NOPAs), • Frequency of case progress meetings and other events. Deduction Only Support Examina- tion All EP examination support as- signments with LB&I or EO, restricted to an EP agent’s inves- tigation of one or more income tax related issue. EO Support Examination All EP support assignments with EO involving at least one IRC 401(a), IRC 403(b) or IRC 457 plan compliance issue, regardless of the scope and whether: • The assignment includes the deduction or other income tax analysis.
Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures 4.71.20

) EP support to an LB&I examination is often limited to issues that affect the LCC taxpayer’s income tax liability. In Deduction Only Support Examinations, EP helps LB&I determine whether their taxpayer’s IRC
deductions are proper.
The EP agent’s examination activity in Deduction Only Support Examinations is restricted to the investigation of one or more income tax issues.

a. The EP audit plan describes the extent of the EP examination activity. b. The EP case ﬁle contains a copy of the EP audit plan. c. The EP group manager reviews and approves the EP audit plan before the agent submits it to LB&I. d. The EP and LB&I case managers approve signiﬁcant changes to the EP audit plan.
Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures 4.71.20
Exception: When the EP agent expands the scope of a Deduction Only Support Examination to include an IRC
(a) compliance issue, the Form
is under examination and the agent must protect the statute of limitations for the plan(s) placed under examination per established procedures. See IRM
, Statute Control Procedures.

) Consider these rules when you prepare IDRs: a. Submit IDRs according to the agreements between LB&I and the taxpayer, unless EP, the LB&I team leader and the taxpayer negotiate something different. b. Limit IDRs to reﬂect the EP audit plan examination scope. LB&I case managers approve the scope of the EP examination. Note: Don’t circumvent the LB&I case manager’s authority by issuing requests that
Note: Don’t circumvent the LB&I case manager’s authority by issuing requests that exceed the scope of your support obligations.

exceed the scope of your support obligations. c. Include the income tax rationale for requesting information. This helps avoid misunderstandings about the entity or entities under examination. d. Avoid submitting IDRs that the taxpayer may construe as having initiated an examination of the plan or entity other than the LB&I taxpayer. These Include requests for an unfunded nonqualiﬁed deferred compensation arrangement and inquiries for the nondeductiblity of Chapter
excise taxes (IRC sections
through
). The former rarely creates a separate audit and the latter never does. e. Follow the procedures in IRM
, Overview of LB&I Support Ex- aminations Involving Plan Qualiﬁcation, when you open a plan examination, whether inadvertently or by intent. (
) LB&I team leaders should review IDRs submitted by team members. (
) The agents should bring any dispute between a team leader and an EP agent as to the need for, or scope of, an IDR to the LB&I and EP group managers for resolution. (
) Avoid inadvertently opening a plan examination. Therefore, limit IDRs to the records of the taxpayer whose return is under examination. (
) Conﬁne your IDRs to the LB&I taxpayer’s records, and those records relating to tax issues requiring specialized assistance. (

) Typically, you can resolve EP related income tax issues by reviewing the LB&I taxpayer’s records. Examples of LB&I taxpayer records used in a Deduction Only Support Examination are: a. Taxpayer’s copy of a favorable determination letter b. Compensation data c. Trust reports that verify the receipt of an employer contribution d. Deductible limit calculations prepared
calculations by plan adminis- trator or the plan actuary

) Don’t request plan administrator or trustee records, unless they are integral resolving the EP deduction issue (primarily IRC
). If you don’t limit your IDR to the LB&I taxpayer’s records, the taxpayer or representative may question which entities are under examination. (

) Don’t request plan records that don’t directly relate to an income tax issue under investigation, as such requests may constitute plan compliance See the list below for examples of plan records you shouldn’t request in a Deduction Only Support Examination: a. Plan allocation schedules b. ADP/ACP nondiscrimination tests c. Plan investment records (except to substantiate employer contributions) d. Coverage and IRC
) testing e. Beneﬁt calculation or distribution records & (

Submit the form to your group manager for approval. The group manager or designee will email the approved form to Classiﬁ- cation’s group mailbox at *TE/GE-EP-Classiﬁcation and to the agent. Save a copy of the approved form (Related and Subsequent Year Form
Request) in the RCCMS Office Documents folder using the RCCMS Naming Convention.
Acknowledge receipt of the request to establish the return (normally within
business days). Mark the return on RICS, establish the return on AIMS and RCCMS and update these systems to the group. Inform the agent and group manager (normally within
business days) that the record has been assigned to the group on AIMS and RCCMS.
Note: AIMS will be in status 10 when there is a full AIMS account.
Follow these special rules for project code 6451 and 6055 examinations:

Action Explanation Update the statute of limitations to alpha code “PP” immediately upon assignment. Don’t use alpha code “FF” because our system won’t capture the Deduction Only Support Examination exam results when we use this alpha code. Apply the general statute of limi- tation procedures in IRM 4.71.9 Statute Control Procedures, and protect the statute of limitations for Form 5500/1041 because the plan is then considered to be under exam. If you expand the scope to include an IRC 401(a) issue and the statute of limitations is still open for that year. Use “PP” alpha code for the statute of limitations for that year. Note: If you open Form 5500 exams in later years for which the statute is still open, follow the general statute of limitation proce- dures in IRM 4.71.9 and protect the statute of limi- tations for Form 5500/1041. If you expand the scope to include an IRC 401(a) issue and the statute of limitations is not open for that year.

Apply the general statute of limi- tation procedures in IRM 4.71.9 Statute Control Procedures, and protect the statute of limitations for Form 5500/1041 because the plan is then considered to be under exam.

) Don’t issue a closing letter for Deduction Only Support Examination cases. (
) Communicate your ﬁndings to the LB&I case manager. a. LB&I incorporates EP’s results of related income tax adjustments in its examination report. b. The EP agent prepares Form

-A or other written feedback to address their Deduction Only Support Examination ﬁndings and conclusions. c. The LB&I case manager communicates any EP issues to the taxpayer part of the overall LB&I examination report. (

of Form
, if required, and in the RCCMS closing record details tab line item titled “Adjustment to SB/SE, W&I, LB&I.” (
) When you establish only one return, don’t restrict the entry on Form

to only that of the plan year you established on AIMS. To properly capture LB&I support activity, enter the total recommended deduction adjustment (increase or decrease) derived from all EP related code sections, for all corporate tax years, and for all deferred compensation arrangements qualiﬁed or otherwise on the one record established. ): a. Notify the plan sponsor in writing that an EP examination is being conducted. b. Conduct an EP speciﬁc opening conference with the plan sponsor. c. Note: Even though LB&I may have apprised the taxpayer (typically the plan sponsor) of their examination rights, you still must inform of the same for the plan examination. f. Employee Plans Large Case Support Examination Procedures 4.71.20
) Overview of EO Support Examinations Involving Plan Qualiﬁcation (
) This IRM section lists procedures for EP agents providing support in EO TEP examinations. (
) Most EO examination support involves an EP agent examining one or more these EO-maintained deferred compensation arrangements: a. Qualiﬁed plans under IRC
(a) b. Eligible deferred compensation plans under IRC
(b) c. Tax-sheltered arrangements under IRC
) Follow the procedures of IRM
, LB&I Support Involving Plan Qualiﬁca- tion, when examining one of these types of arrangements except substitute “EO” for “LB&I” as the entity being supported. (
) Protect the statute of limitations according to IRM
, Statute Control cedures, for any taxable plan trust. (
) Although relatively infrequent, you may encounter an EO Deduction Only Support Examination when the EO TEP examination includes: a. Related taxable entities b. Form
-T c. Organizations that lose their exempt status d. Taxability of nonqualiﬁed deferred compensation plans (
) If the scope of EP examination involvement is restricted to income tax issues involving the returns or scenarios in IRM
), follow the procedures of IRM
, Deduction Only Support Examinations, except coordinate with EO instead of LB&I.
) EO Support Examinations Involving Plan Qualiﬁcation - AIMS and RCCMS Establishment (
) The procedures to establish the case on AIMS and RCCMS depends on the type of deferred compensation arrangement under examination. (

series return: a. Research IDRS to verify that the Form
series return has posted the EPMF. Note: If the return hasn’t posted on the EPMF, follow the appropriate cedures in IRM
